datafield.subfield: Leo Sarkisian Voice of America African music collection

Known as "The Music Man," Leo Sarkisian hosted "Music Time in Africa" for Voice of America for many decades. Mr. Sarkisian's music collection was compiled as he helped to establish radio stations in newly independent African nations as an employee of the US State Department. During more than 50 years of traveling and recording music in Africa, he interviewed scores of musicians and compiled an enormous collection of recordings that reflects the continent's broad heritage of traditional and popular music. The Sarkisian Collection contains a digitized selection of 360 of his field recordings and broadcast reels.
Converted with permission from reel-to-reel tapes to digital sound discs.
Sound discs can only be used in Music Library.

The Collection is owned by the BBG broadcast service Voice of America, compiled by Leo Sarkisian in the scope of his employment with VOA's African Service. In 2009, VOA entered an agreement with the University of Michigan Library to digitize the reels that comprise the Collection for preservation purposes and to provide access for teaching, research, and other non-commercial purposes. This is a continuing relationship in which VOA provides the UM Library with reels for digitization on a revolving basis, thus additional materials will be added over time.
